9.Let $P(x)$ be the statement‘ $\cdot_{x}$ can speak Russian"and let $Q(x)$ be the statement‘ $\scriptstyle{\mathit{\Omega}}_{x}$ knows the computer language ${\mathsf{C}}^{++\"}$ .Expresseachofthefollowingsentenceintermsof $P(x),Q(x)$ ,quantifiers,and logical connectives.For the universe of discourse for quantifiers use thesetof all studentsatyour school. 
a) There is a student at your school who can speak Russian and who knows $\mathsf C^{++}$ b)a) There is a student at your school who can speak Russian but who does not know $\mathsf C^{++}$ c) Every student at your school either can speak Russian or knows $\mathsf C^{++}$ d) No student at your school speak Russian or knows $\mathsf C^{++}$ 
Solution:a) $\exists x(P(x)\land Q(x))$   
b) $\exists x(P(x)\land\lnot Q(x))$   
c) $\forall x(P(x)\lor Q(x))$   
d) $\forall x\neg(P(x)\lor Q(x))$
